New Records: Rohit Sharma posted 106 off 66 balls at Dharamsala on October 2, 2015 - the highest for India vs South Africa in a T20I.
Suresh Raina's 101 off 60 balls vs South Africa at Gros Islet on May 2, 2010 was the first hundred by an Indian player in T20Is and in the T20 World Cup.

Virat Kohli posted a match-winning unbeaten 72 off 44 balls in a T20 World Cup fixture at Mirpur on April 4, 2014 - India's highest individual score in successful run chases vs South Africa in T20Is/World Cup.
Bhuvneshwar Kumar, with 14 wickets at 17.00 runs apiece in 11 matches, is the highest wicket-taker in T20Is involving India and South Africa.
An unbroken stand of 174 between David Miller and de Kock for the fourth wicket is South Africa's highest for any wicket against any opponent in T20Is.
The above partnership is also the highest by any pair for this wicket-position in T20Is.
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli's match-winning unbeaten 72 off 44 balls in a T20 World Cup fixture at Mirpur on April 4, 2014 - India's highest individual score in successful run chases vs South Africa in T20Is/World Cup.
India (176/4) got to their target of 173 vs South Africa at Mirpur on April 4, 2014 - their highest successful run chase against any opponent in the T20 World Cup.
Pre-Game Insights: India will be up against a very high on confidence Protea outfit, who were robbed of 1 point when rain forced them to split points with Zimbabwe. Currently the Proteas are right behind India on the Group 2 points table, with 3 points.
Today's match which will be played on an expected fast and bouncy Perth pitch could well give us the answer to who will top Group 2.
Post-Match Reflections: The match outcome will significantly impact India's qualification chances for the semi-finals.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match is expected to be played on a fast and bouncy Perth pitch.
This is the latest encounter in a long-standing rivalry between India and South Africa in T20 cricket.
Others: The match is part of the ongoing T20 World Cup in Australia.
